fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.pohjaeetu.util

Class Arrays

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.pohjaeetu.util.Arrays

  • public class Arrays
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Arrays contains methods for array based operations, such as converting String array into an int array.
    Author:
    Eetu Pohja

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Arrays() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean contains(int value, int[] array)
      Checks if the given value is found inside the given array and returns true or false accordingly.
      static int containsSameValues(int[] array1, int[] array2)
      Takes two different int arrays, compares the values in them and returns the amount of matching pairs.
      static int[] createAscNumberArray(int startNum, int endNum)
      Creates and returns an ascending int array with values in the range of given values.
      static java.lang.String[] makeHelperStringArray(int amount)
      Creates and returns a String array holding the given amount of helper Strings for naming placement numbers, for example "1st", "2nd", "3rd".
      static int[] removeIndex(int[] original, int index)
      Takes an int array, copies it into a new int array excluding the given index and returns the new array.
      static int[] setToZeroes(int[] arr)
      Takes an int array, sets all values to zero and returns the array.
      static int[] sort(int[] array)
      Takes an array, sorts the values into ascending order and returns it.
      static int[] toIntArray(java.lang.String[] array)
      Takes String array and converts and returns it as an int array.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Arrays

        public Arrays()

    • Method Detail

      • toIntArray

        public static int[] toIntArray(java.lang.String[] array)
        Takes String array and converts and returns it as an int array. The String array must only contain characters that can be converted to an int, otherwise the method will print out an error message and the value for the corresponding int array index will be 0.
        Parameters:
        array - takes a String array which is to be converted to an int array.
        Returns:
        the converted String array as an int array.

      • contains

        public static boolean contains(int value,
                               int[] array)
        Checks if the given value is found inside the given array and returns true or false accordingly.
        Parameters:
        value - takes the value which is compared to values in the given array.
        array - takes the array which holds the values to be compared to.
        Returns:
        true if value was found in the array and false if value was not found in the array.

      • containsSameValues

        public static int containsSameValues(int[] array1,
                                     int[] array2)
        Takes two different int arrays, compares the values in them and returns the amount of matching pairs. For the values to match, they do not have to have the same array index, every value in the first array is compared to every value in the second array.
        Parameters:
        array1 - first array used to compare values.
        array2 - second array used to compare values.
        Returns:
        the amount of matching pairs found in the given arrays.

      • removeIndex

        public static int[] removeIndex(int[] original,
                                int index)
        Takes an int array, copies it into a new int array excluding the given index and returns the new array. The new array's length will always be original array's length - 1.
        Parameters:
        original - the array which wil be copied except the given index.
        index - the index which will be excluded when copying the original array to the new array.
        Returns:
        the new array without the excluded index.

      • createAscNumberArray

        public static int[] createAscNumberArray(int startNum,
                                         int endNum)
        Creates and returns an ascending int array with values in the range of given values. A value in index will always be greater by one than the value in the previous index. For example, array with startNum 5 and endNum 10 will hold numbers 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10.
        Parameters:
        startNum - the number from where the values inside the array will start to ascend.
        endNum - the greatest/last number in the array.
        Returns:
        an array with all integer numbers in the given range.

      • makeHelperStringArray

        public static java.lang.String[] makeHelperStringArray(int amount)
        Creates and returns a String array holding the given amount of helper Strings for naming placement numbers, for example "1st", "2nd", "3rd".
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of indexes the array will hold.
        Returns:
        a String array holding the given amount of helping Strings for naming numbers.

      • sort

        public static int[] sort(int[] array)
        Takes an array, sorts the values into ascending order and returns it.
        Parameters:
        array - takes the array that will be sorted.
        Returns:
        the sorted array.

      • setToZeroes

        public static int[] setToZeroes(int[] arr)
        Takes an int array, sets all values to zero and returns the array.
        Parameters:
        arr - takes the array which values will be set to zeroes.
        Returns:
        the array holding zeroes.
